intro: Papaver dubium var. laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth poppy, is a variant of the common poppy characterized by its smooth, unribbed stem and leaves. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in grassy fields and woodland edges. The plant produces striking, showy flowers with bright orange or red petals, often with a black or dark purple center. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its medicinal and historical uses. The seeds are also used in traditional herbal remedies and as a source of opium alkaloids.
